Author: oriz345
Title: [ANN] The Divi Project [DIVI] - The First Crypto for Mainstream Adoption
Body: I'm an ICO investor - the exchange rate doesn't make a difference. Everything scales accordingly, so a copper would now be 100,000 if say the chosen ratio is 1:100. Also, some consider this inflation but I disagree. I like to use this example: Say you have $100 you want to sell, and you find the demand(a buyer) for that $100. Now you can choose what bills you want to use. Right now the supply = 1 $100 bill. Say a 1:100 ratio is voted for, so now it's as if you just gave them the same amount of money, but with 100 $1 bills. It really doesn't matter if it's 1 $100 bills, 5 $20 bills, 2 $50 bills etc, the demand for the same amount of money is still there.  The market cap here stays the same. Now, if instead, you were to all of a sudden decide you want to sell $10,000($100X100), without the demand for that, that would be inflation. But simply changing the exchange rate does nothing but make liquidity better and gets price closer to what people are used to with forex.

Body: This is an excellent point on merchant adoption, and one reason I was so impressed with Divi's plans in the WP to help merchants to move customers to adoption.   WP page 8  https://diviproject.org/assets/files/wp-en.pdf  Early Adopters Fund for Merchants The Divi Project is tackling this challenge by committing at leas t 10% of its cash and coins to entice online merchants to accept DIVI as payment, educational videos and staff to show them how it works, and to provide them with easily embeddable tools to do so. We don’t need every store online to accept DIVI, but we do need a critical mass of them so that people with DIVI can spend it on something, and the store owners themselves can in return spend it again, or use it for staking, rather than just converting it to bitcoin or dollars. Our plan to start is to get at least one good online vendor in every major category, in the biggest markets such as the U.S. and Europe. These retailers will discover a new revenue stream with DIVI, stick with us, and we expand from there.

Author: Quordant
Title: [ANN] The Divi Project [DIVI] - The First Crypto for Mainstream Adoption
Body: I think the key element Divi is missing right now is the Reddit demographic, with just 17 readers on the sub. I think having some of the developers or team members make accounts and start delivering information through reddit as well, it will show people that you are all real and actually engaged in this project, and not another get-rich-quick scheme. Because I'm sorry but that's what the subreddit screams.  1) The headliner for the sub is super obnoxious: "Crypto. Made. Easy" Yes it was in the video, but with the periods? Really?  2) The sidebar is even worse: "Divi will offer a “One-Click Master Node” system that will accumulate residual income for users. This offers a way for users to accrue passive income that can be monitored easily from all operating systems and mobile smartphone devices."  That's literally it. No information about what Divi IS, or what the mission is. No links to any official pages (website, twitter, telegram, bitcointalk, etc)  Yes it's all in the FAQ but having the current blurb in the sidebar just makes this whole thing look like a complete sham. Even the FAQ itself NEVER talks about what the Divi mission/goal is. Instead, it goes on and on about the token sale, divx vs divi, and masternodes. Sure masternodes are the rage right now, but you have to give people a good reason WHY they would want to support the network. It generates tokens for them, but what is it about Divi that stands out from the hundreds of other shitmastercoins, where people stake coins worth dog shit because it has no actual, practical use-case in the end? Obviously Divi does have more going for it, but NONE of that is apparent on first glance.  When people hear about a new project, many of them check reddit (among others) for information. I didn't want to invest in Divi because the reddit made it seem like a get-rich-quick scam.  I don't mean to come off rude if I did- I would be happy to see Divi do well- just my two cents.

Body: I think you're right, the tech is not always the most important thing.  The community that forms around a crypto is what drives its value.  The technology provides no value alone but creates hype the makes a community excited about its potential future.  A good example is IOTA.  People love the tangle and are becoming big fans of it, even though it's not actually doing anything right now.  What I can tell you is that we're very aware of the community aspect.  If you visit our slack or telegram, you'll find us always there to answer questions, and treat everyone with respect.  We love to turn critics into fans.  If you look at our team, you'll notice that we have a woman named Heidi Krupp.  She and her husband Darren are top NYC publicists.  We have a 2-5 year plan (as long as it takes) to bring Divi to the attention of millions of people through publicity.  Heidi works with Tony Robbins, Gary Vaynerchuck, Oprah Winfrey, etc, etc.   Right now, in the media the only coin that's in the news is Bitcoin.  Sometimes they talk about Ethereum.  Occasionally you hear about Monero because some criminals are using it.   Divi will be the other one you're going to hear about, with a story about how it's so much easier to use than other cryptocurrencies.  It's for regular people.  It's security is better and safer.  It's like using PayPal but can do so much more.  This is an easy story to sell because everyone hears about Bitcoin, but when they start looking into it, only a tiny community of geeks want anything to do with it.  Divi will change that.

Author: gmacc
Title: [ANN] The Divi Project [DIVI] - The First Crypto for Mainstream Adoption
Body: Having a masternode is like being a miner.  It gives you a chance to earn the right to add a block to the blockchain.  If your masternode is a higher level, you get an extra multiplier effect that improves your chances to win the block.  Like this:  1000 Coins - Level 1: Copper 3000 Coins - Level 2: Silver +5% 10,000 Coins - Level 3: Gold +10% 30,000 Coins - Level 4: Platinum +15% 100,000 Coins - Level 5: Diamond + 20%  This encourages people to hold onto more coins, and try to accumulate more to reach a higher level.  More people holding coins means more stability in the network, and more scarcity of coins, which helps the value.  Owning a masternode also allows you to participate in the governance system and have a vote in the future of the Divi network itself.

Title: [ANN] The Divi Project [DIVI] - The First Crypto for Mainstream Adoption
Body: From Divi's slack channel:  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------  Former Yahoo Chief Solutions Officer Joins Cryptocurrency Startup  Tim Sanders, tech guru, writer, speaker, and business consultant, has joined The Divi Project to help run its operations and attain its goal to be the first cryptocurrency to achieve mass adoption by the general public.  Former Yahoo CSO Tim Sanders has joined crypto wallet startup The Divi Project, describing the venture as a potentially ‘world-changing’ opportunity to take cryptocurrencies into the mainstream.  The Divi Project stands apart from its peers, doing away with jargon-heavy language and adopting a more user-friendly approach, whilst maintaining the high levels of technological sophistication necessary to run an effective crypto interface.  “For the last five years,” says Sanders, “I’ve been watching the cryptocurrency scene, looking for the best opportunity to help a team change the world. Divi is that opportunity. The team will make digital currency easier to buy, use and transfer for mainstream investors (like me). From one-click solutions to their master node offering, this team gets what it’s going to take to take this industry beyond the tipping point.”  Central to this user-end simplification is the addition of names, emails and metadata to each transaction - an innovation Tim Sanders likens to Apple’s revolutionary ‘design acumen and appliance-level ease of use’ in the home computing industry:  “Divi’s design approach takes the complexity and fear out of cryptocurrency. They’ve demonstrated the ability to not only dream big, but to execute the plan. Those are the two ingredients I look for when getting involved in a company.”  Based on a multi-tiered masternode system, The Divi Project facilitates coin-holder maintenance of the network, enabling them to earn more as they help the currency survive and thrive. The Divi Project aims to help crypto meet its potential by building a truly global marketplace that can be used by billions of ordinary people.  It’s a vision shared by web pioneer Sanders, who has spotted a potential for expansion sorely lacking in rival cryptocurrencies.  “The promise of Blockchain and cryptocurrency was decentralization. Of course, we all know how that played out with Bitcoin and Mt. Gox. Divi’s approach will enable coin owners to truly manage their currency, without needing a digital-bank of sorts to help them buy, hold and trade it. Their technology will not only help the Divi currency rise in value, it could potentially offer Flickr-like spin off value by licensing technologies to other crypto-companies.”
